quote: Know thy self, know thy enemy. A thousand battles, a thousand victories.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: There is no hunting like the hunting of man, and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it, never care for anything else thereafter.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more you sweat in peace, the less you bleed in war.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: We shall defend our island, whatever the cost may be, we shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds, we shall fight in the fields and in the streets, we shall fight in the hills; we shall never surrender.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Older men declare war. But it is the youth that must fight and die.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: War does not determine who is right - only who is left.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: In peace, sons bury their fathers. In war, fathers bury their sons.
author: Herodotus

quote: It is well that war is so terrible, otherwise we should grow too fond of it.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effective means of preserving peace.
author: George Washington

quote: Only the dead have seen the end of the war.
author: George Santayana

quote: If we don't end war, war will end us.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: When the rich wage war, it's the poor who die.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I hate war as only a soldier who has lived it can, only as one who has seen its brutality, its futility, its stupidity.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The military don't start wars. Politicians start wars.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: There is no avoiding war; it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The great questions of the day will not be settled by means of speeches and majority decisions but by iron and blood.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: I have never advocated war except as a means of peace.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.
author: John Adams

quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: All wars are civil wars, because all men are brothers.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: War: a massacre of people who don't know each other for the profit of people who know each other but don't massacre each other.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.
author: Euripides

quote: War makes thieves and peace hangs them.
author: George Herbert

quote: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: You can't say civilization don't advance... in every war they kill you in a new way.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Yesterday, December seventh, 1941, a date which will live in infamy, the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan. We will gain the inevitable triumph, so help us God.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: It is incumbent on every generation to pay its own debts as it goes. A principle which if acted on would save one-half the wars of the world.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I will not play tug o' war. I'd rather play hug o' war. Where everyone hugs instead of tugs, Where everyone giggles and rolls on the rug, Where everyone kisses, and everyone grins, and everyone cuddles, and everyone wins.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: I'm fed up to the ears with old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.
author: George McGovern

quote: If it's natural to kill, how come men have to go into training to learn how?
author: Joan Baez

quote: Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war that we know about peace, more about killing that we know about living.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: Conquered, we conquer.
author: Plautus

quote: War is only a cowardly escape from the problems of peace.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: A state of war only serves as an excuse for domestic tyranny.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: War is the science of destruction.
author: John Abbott

quote: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Sweat saves blood.
author: Erwin Rommel

quote: In battle it is the cowards who run the most risk; bravery is a rampart of defense.
author: Sallust

quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: I have not yet begun to fight!
author: John Paul Jones

quote: The first casualty when war comes is truth.
author: Hiram Johnson

quote: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Unknown

quote: War never takes a wicked man by chance, the good man always.
author: Sophocles

quote: War would end if the dead could return.
author: Stanley Baldwin

quote: Wars have never hurt anybody except the people who die.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: John Dalton's records, carefully preserved for a century, were destroyed during the World War II bombing of Manchester. It is not only the living who are killed in war.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: War is a series of catastrophes which result in victory.
author: Albert Pike

quote: If it were a fact, it wouldn't be called intelligence.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Remember, God provides the best camouflage several hours out of every 24.
author: David M. Shoup

quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
